-  "notes": "AI triage (codex): The issue is stale and does not include current reproducible steps on v1.79.x, so the multi-select delete/inheritance bug cannot be confirmed yet.\nApproach: Request a retest on the latest build with exact steps, expected vs actual behavior, and whether Delete via keyboard and context menu differ."
+  "notes": "AI triage (codex): The issue is stale and does not include current reproducible steps on v1.79.x, so the multi-select delete/inheritance bug cannot be confirmed yet.\nApproach: Request a retest on the latest build with exact steps, expected vs actual behavior, and whether Delete via keyboard and context menu differ.\nAI triage (gemini): The Delete key shortcut via ContextMenu is unreliable because the menu's enabled state only updates when opened; adding an explicit KeyDown handler ensures deletion works for both single and multiple selections.\nApproach: In 'mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionTreeWindow.cs', modify 'TvConnections_KeyDown' to explicitly handle 'Keys.Delete' by calling 'ConnectionTree.DeleteSelectedNode()', ensuring the delete action triggers regardless of the context menu's state."
 }
